title: I just want to point out...
body:
Wether you think it relates to us or not (and i personally think it does) our server skin is the best looking skin of all the regional ones...
plus new particles that most other regional skins lack.

have a think about that.

replies.body: Yea you're right, Masked shaco is pretty cool though but our one is better.
Bear Cavalry Sejuani looks awesome. Kassadin skin's abilities do look really cool though. Especially his Q.
It's also the only 'server skin that costs that server for the skin.

Turkey had 50% off for Sultan Tyrndamere - "Sultan Tryndamere is now available for purchase and, in celebration of the Turkish server launch, he is temporarily available for the lowered price of 487 RP!"

http://www.surrenderat20.net/2012/09/sultan-tryndamere-now-available.html

Hey man, two years in development for an unthemed skin, worth the wait!

Praise Riot for giving us a 50% discount, despite other regions getting 25% discount on 1350 skins on release, so really it's only 25%.

And make sure you focus on the charity part, to distract you from the terrible choice of skin and how they're getting in one last f*cking over in this Oce skin saga :)

I thought about it.

Feel like I wasted my time.

Probably how Riot feels.

http://static1.gamespot.com/uploads/original/983/9837141/2618670-0199714375-Kappa.png

2 bloody years thats a bit much for rito dont you think. they would step out of stealing peoples money to make a skin thats worth it ... #{{champion:38}} 

#{{champion:203}} its portrait in client is an ahri and is now an annie y?
considering it took them 2 years to think of it you'd expect so.

No shit it's the best looking, it's fucking 2 years late.

Skin quality in general has been increased, but honestly, it's a shit skin when compared to current releases.
no doubt it's a good skin, but it no way relates to just OCE. it relates to human history in general....
I think that's the first positive thing I've ever seen you write.
Positivity is a matter of perspective, but I'm glad our interests align on this one :)
